result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Marcus Lusk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Marcus Lusk was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Joshua Marcus Lusk was found guilty of Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,500.00 to Tanisha J.; and $500.00 to Lou Y.  Joint and several with the coactors.  To be paid first, before costs/fees/assessments/surcharges.

Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges  to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.
AS TO COSTS/FEES/SURCHARGES/RESTITUTION: DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance during term of Extended Supervison.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three; and consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED/HSED.  After obtaining GED/HSED.  Fulltime employment or part time employment and school.

No illegal substances.
No Contact Order with Tanisha J., Frank M., or Lou Y.
No Contact Order with the coactors Davis and/or Kelly 15CF05050.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further defendant advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two; and consecutive to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Marcus Lusk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (55 pages) commencing MAY 31, 2016, received and filed.  jm
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Lou Y. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25357116 in court 2x on 10/7/15, 2/10/16.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Tanisha J. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25357115 in court 2x on 2/10/16, 5/31/16.
File previously scanned.
Associated with Charge #2
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 6/1/16 for Tanisha J. for 2 appearances on 2/10/16, 5/31/16; Lou Y. for 2 appearances on 10/7/15, 2/10/16.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Jamal G., and defendant. 

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  24  months, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 3 and consecutive to any other sentence  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  12  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  12  months.

As to Count 3:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  24  months, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  12  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  12  months.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  Obtain GED/HSD
-  After obtaining GED/HSD - full-time employment or part-time employment and school
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  No illegal substances
-  No Contact Order with Tanisha J.,   AND/OR   Frank M.,    AND/OR   Lou Y.
-  No Contact Order with the co-actors Davis   AND/OR  Kelly (15CF05050)
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $2,500 to Tanisha J. - joint and several with the co-actors
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $500 to Lou Y. -  joint and several with the co-actors
-  Pay Restitution during the term of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Defense counsel submits papers to the court as to sentencing.

Defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk in court with Attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count  2 and Count  3:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count  1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count  1  DISMISSED.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.

Attorney Thomas K Hackbart in court, defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk not in court, in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Count 3:  Receiving Stolen Property - (> $2500 - $5000), a Class I Felony, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 943.34(1)(bf), 939.50(3)(i)

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart telephones the court indicating he is ill and unable to appear before the court, defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted telephonically.  Parties request matter be scheduled for final pretrial and jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury Trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Defense needs time to go through discovery and to get an offer from the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Mattioli-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Tanisha J; Frank M; Lou Y.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Joshua Marcus Lusk in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
